definition: (idiom) not to yield an inch
a unit of length/inch/thumb
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
(negative prefix)/not/no
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: If I were in your position, I wouldn't give up an inch.
sentences.chinese: 如果我处在你的位置，我会寸步不让。

sentences.english: He refused to compromise his principles.
sentences.chinese: 他对他的原则寸步不让。

sentences.english: But the guard stood his ground.
sentences.chinese: 但是这儿的门卫寸步不让。

sentences.english: 'We've gone head-to-head on that sometimes, ' Ms.
sentences.chinese: 瑞吉女士说，有时候我们会因此寸步不让。

sentences.english: Adams was clearly not going to budge without first talking directly to the president personally.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯在总统亲自和他交谈之前，显然寸步不让。

sentences.english: They had to be dealt with diplomatically but firmly.
sentences.chinese: 对这种人必须有外交手腕但又寸步不让。

sentences.english: Pakistan will dig in its heels, as will other regional powers.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦会寸步不让，其他的地区力量也会效仿。

sentences.english: He decided to hang tough rather than give in.
sentences.chinese: 他决定寸步不让，决不屈服。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
neither giving way to the other
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
uncompromising
to be ready to go to war
unyielding attitude
overbearing/forceful/aggressive/menacing/imperious
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
to remain unmoved
according to reason/in principle
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
